snippet: A 70-year-old labor union activist who had been jailed in Mali’s earlier struggle against dictatorship will lead a temporary government that aims to organize new elections within 40 days.
abstract: Dioncounda Traore, 70-year-old labor union activist who was jailed in Mali's earlier struggle against dictatorship, is sworn in as country's interim leader; aims to organize new elections and guide the country back to constitutional rule.

byline.original: By FABIEN OFFNER and LYDIA POLGREEN
byline.contributor: Fabien Offner reported from Bamako, and Lydia Polgreen from Harare, Zimbabwe.

lead_paragraph: A 70-year-old labor union activist who had been jailed in Mali’s earlier struggle against dictatorship will lead a temporary government that aims to organize new elections within 40 days.

headline.main: As Mali Prepares for Vote, Interim Leader Is Sworn In
headline.print_headline: As Mali Prepares for Vote, Interim Leader Is Sworn In
